Name: Internal Medicine
Description: Focuses on the diagnosis, treatment, and prevention of adult diseases. Internists manage conditions like diabetes, hypertension, heart disease, and infections.

Name: General Surgery
Description: Deals with surgical procedures to treat diseases, injuries, or deformities. Surgeons perform operations on organs like the stomach, liver, and intestines.

Name: Pediatrics
Description: Specializes in the medical care of infants, children, and adolescents. Pediatricians manage growth, development, and childhood illnesses.

Name: Obstetrics and Gynecology (OB/GYN)
Description: Focuses on women’s health, including pregnancy, childbirth, and reproductive system disorders. OB/GYNs perform surgeries like cesarean sections and hysterectomies

Name: Orthopedics
Description: Deals with the musculoskeletal system, including bones, joints, ligaments, and muscles. Orthopedic surgeons treat fractures, arthritis, and sports injuries.

Name: Cardiology
Description: Focuses on heart and vascular system disorders. Cardiologists manage conditions like heart failure, arrhythmias, and coronary artery disease.

Name: Neurology
Description: Specializes in disorders of the nervous system, including the brain, spinal cord, and nerves. Neurologists treat conditions like epilepsy, stroke, and multiple sclerosis.

Name: Radiology
Description: Uses imaging techniques like X-rays, CT scans, and MRIs to diagnose and treat diseases. Radiologists interpret images to guide treatment plans.

Name: BA (Hons) in English Language Studies (Translation)
Description: Extensive training in written, consecutive, and simultaneous translation, preparing graduates to handle knowledge transfer between languages.

Name: BA (Hons) in English Language Studies (Executive Skills)
Description: Training in managerial fields, including human resources management, business administration, and organizational behavior, equipping graduates with practical skills for employment.

Name: BA (Hons) in English Language Studies (Teaching English as a Foreign Language - TEFL)
Description: Qualifies students for teaching careers in national and international institutions, offering up-to-date teaching methods and approaches.

Name: BA (Hons) in English Language Studies (Comparative Studies)
Description: Focuses on literature, cinema, and theatre, enhancing students' critical thinking and research skills.

Name: Interior Design
Description: Focuses on designing functional and aesthetically pleasing indoor spaces.

Name: Fashion Design

Description: Emphasizes visual communication through digital and traditional media.

Name: Cinema and Theatre & Production Design
Description: nvolves designing sets and visuals for film and theater productions.

Description: Combines architecture with engineering principles to design building systems.

Name: Civil Engineering Systems

Name: Mechatronics Systems Engineering

Name: Broadcast Platforms

Name: Accounting

Name: Physical Therapy

Name: General Medicine & Subspecialties Department
Description:
This department encompasses various internal medicine disciplines, including:

Cardiovascular: Focuses on the study of the heart and vascular diseases, covering both medical and interventional management approaches.

Critical Care: Emphasizes the integration of medical knowledge in managing life-threatening conditions.

General Medicine: Addresses diseases affecting various organ systems, from diagnosis to treatment.

Geriatric Medicine: Studies the aging process and diseases common in older adults, aiming to promote healthy aging.

Neuropsychiatry: Explores the interface between neurological and psychiatric disorders.

Name: Surgery Department
Description:
This department covers various surgical specialties, including:

Cardiothoracic Surgery: Deals with surgical procedures involving the heart and thoracic organs.

General Surgery: Focuses on surgical management of a wide range of diseases, emphasizing timely decision-making and basic surgical skills.

Neurosurgery: Specializes in surgical interventions for neurological disorders.

Name: Obstetrics & Gynecology Department
Description: Concentrates on women's reproductive health, including pregnancy, childbirth, and disorders of the reproductive system.

Name: Pediatrics Department
Description: Dedicated to the medical care of infants, children, and adolescents, addressing both acute and chronic health issues.

Name: Psychiatry Department
Description: Focuses on the diagnosis, treatment, and prevention of mental health disorders, aiming to improve patients' mental well-being.

Name: Physical Medicine Department
Description: Emphasizes rehabilitation and physical therapy to enhance and restore functional ability and quality of life.

Name: Urology Department
Description: Deals with diseases of the urinary tract and the male reproductive system, offering both medical and surgical treatments.

Name: Dermatology, Venereology, and Andrology Department
Description: Specializes in skin diseases, sexually transmitted infections, and male reproductive health.

Name: Anesthesiology & Intensive Care Unit (ICU) Department
Description: Focuses on pain relief during surgeries and critical care management in the ICU.

Name: Neurology Department
Description: Dedicated to disorders of the nervous system, including the brain, spinal cord, and peripheral nerves.

Name: Radiology Department
Description: Utilizes imaging technologies, such as X-rays and MRIs, for diagnosis and treatment planning.

Name: Anatomy Department
Description: Studies the structure of the human body, providing foundational knowledge for medical practice.

Name: Physiology Department
Description: Explores the functions and mechanisms of the human body, essential for understanding health and disease.

Name: Biochemistry Department
Description: Investigates the chemical processes within the human body, crucial for comprehending metabolic functions.

Name: Histology Department
Description: Examines the microscopic structure of tissues, aiding in the understanding of normal and pathological conditions.

Name: Pathology Department
Description: Studies disease mechanisms and effects, bridging basic science and clinical practice.

Name: Pharmacology Department
Description: Focuses on drug actions and interactions, essential for effective and safe therapeutic practices.

Name: Microbiology Department
Description: Investigates microorganisms and their roles in human health and disease, emphasizing infection control.

Name: Parasitology Department
Description: Studies parasites and their impact on human health, contributing to the prevention and treatment of parasitic diseases.

Name: Community Medicine Department
Description: Emphasizes public health principles, aiming to improve health outcomes at the community level.

Name: Family Medicine Department
Description: Provides comprehensive healthcare across all ages, focusing on continuous and holistic patient care.

Name: Forensic Medicine & Toxicology Department
Description: Deals with medical aspects of the law and the effects of chemicals on the human body, playing a crucial role in legal investigations.

Name: Ophthalmology Department
Description: Specializes in the diagnosis and treatment of eye disorders, promoting visual health.

Name: Otorhinolaryngology (ENT) Department
Description: Focuses on diseases of the ear, nose, and throat, addressing both medical and surgical treatments.

Name: Nursing
Description: Focuses on providing comprehensive patient care, health promotion, and disease prevention.

Name: Technology of Medical Laboratory
Description: Emphasizes the analysis of biological samples to diagnose diseases.

Name: Radiological Imaging Technology
Description: Centers on using imaging techniques like X-rays and MRIs for medical diagnosis.

Name: Technology of Respiratory Care
Description: Specializes in caring for patients with respiratory disorders.

Name: Department of Basic Sciences for Physical Therapy
Description: This department focuses on foundational sciences that underpin physical therapy practices, ensuring students grasp essential concepts necessary for effective patient care.

Name: Unit of Biomechanics
Description: Dedicated to understanding human movement, this unit emphasizes the mechanical aspects of motion, crucial for assessing and improving physical function.

Name: Department of Physical Therapy for Cardiopulmonary Disorders and the Elderly
Description: Specializing in therapies for heart and lung conditions, this department also addresses the unique needs of aging populations, promoting optimal respiratory and cardiovascular health.

Name: Department of Physical Therapy for Musculoskeletal Diseases and Its Surgeries
Description: Focusing on conditions affecting muscles, bones, and joints, this department provides therapeutic interventions to restore mobility and alleviate pain.

Name: Unit of Physical Therapy for Surgeries & Burns
Description: This unit offers rehabilitation strategies for patients recovering from surgeries and burn injuries, aiming to restore function and improve quality of life.

Name: Department of Physical Therapy for Neuromuscular Diseases and Its Surgeries
Description: Concentrating on disorders of the nervous and muscular systems, this department provides therapies to enhance neural function and muscle strength.

Name: Department of Physical Therapy for Pediatric Diseases and Its Surgeries
Description: Tailored for children, this department addresses developmental and surgical conditions, ensuring young patients achieve optimal physical development.

Name: Unit of Physical Therapy for Women’s Health
Description: Focusing on health issues unique to women, this unit provides therapies addressing conditions related to childbirth, pelvic health, and more.

Name: Pharmaceutics
Description: This department focuses on the formulation, preparation, and testing of pharmaceutical dosage forms, ensuring that medications are safe, effective, and of high quality.

Name: Industrial Pharmacy
Description: Emphasizing the large-scale production of pharmaceuticals, this department integrates principles of engineering and quality assurance to optimize manufacturing processes and ensure compliance with regulatory standards.

Name: Clinical Pharmacy Practice
Description: Dedicated to the application of pharmacological knowledge in clinical settings, this department trains students to work directly with healthcare teams to optimize patient medication therapies and improve health outcomes.

Name: Pharmacognosy
Description: This department investigates medicinal substances derived from natural sources, including plants and marine organisms, focusing on the discovery and development of new therapeutic agents.

Name: Pharmaceutical Analytical Chemistry
Description: Specializing in the techniques and methods used to analyze pharmaceutical compounds, this department ensures the purity, potency, and quality of drugs through rigorous testing and validation processes

Name: Pharmaceutical Chemistry
Description: Concentrating on the chemical aspects of drug design and development, this department explores the synthesis and characterization of new pharmaceutical agents, contributing to the advancement of medicinal chemistry.

Name: Pharmacology
Description: This department studies the effects of drugs on biological systems, providing essential insights into drug actions, therapeutic uses, and potential adverse effects.

Name: Microbiology and Immunology
Description: Focusing on microorganisms and the immune system, this department examines the interactions between pathogens and hosts, contributing to the development of vaccines and antimicrobial therapies.

Name: Biochemistry
Description: This department explores the chemical processes within living organisms, offering a deeper understanding of drug interactions at the molecular level and supporting the development of targeted therapies.

Name: Oral Pathology & Oral Surgery Department
Description: This department aims to provide students with the scientific foundations and intellectual skills necessary to diagnose a wide range of oral diseases. It also equips dentists to manage cases involving tooth extractions, jaw fractures, tumors, and temporomandibular joint disorders.

Name: Pediatric Dentistry, Orthodontics, & Oral Biology Department
Description: This department educates students on dental terminology, tooth morphology, structure, and physiology. It prepares students to handle primary teeth in infants and children, including those with special healthcare needs. Additionally, it provides knowledge for diagnosing, preventing, intercepting, and treating malocclusion anomalies.

Name: Prosthodontic Department
Description: This department imparts laboratory and clinical knowledge for constructing complete, partial, and fixed prosthodontics. It also educates students on the chemical, physical, and biological properties of dental materials and their applications across various branches of dentistry.

Name: Conservative Surgery Department
Description: This department focuses on the prevention, diagnosis, and treatment of dental caries and diseases affecting the dental pulp and surrounding tissues. It emphasizes preserving natural teeth through restorative techniques and treatments.

Name: Department of Medical Biotechnology
Description: This department focuses on molecular medicine, including the diagnosis and treatment of diseases through gene therapy and stem cell research.

Name: Department of Pharmaceutical and Industrial Biotechnology
Description: This department emphasizes biopharmaceuticals, pharmacogenomics, drug design, and personalized medicine, preparing students to tackle challenges in pharmaceutical development and industrial biotechnology.

Name: Department of Agricultural Biotechnology
Description: This department centers on the genetic manipulation of plants and animals to improve yield quality and quantity, including the development of transgenic plants and animals for various beneficial traits.

Name: Department of Environmental Biotechnology
Description: This department addresses environmental conservation through bioremediation strategies, wastewater treatment, renewable energy production, and the development of biofertilizers and biopesticides.

Name: Department of Bioinformatics and Functional Genomics
Description: This department integrates biotechnology with information technology to analyze biological data, aiding in understanding diseases and biological processes through computational tools.

Name: Construction Engineering:
Description: Focuses on the planning, design, and management of construction projects, ensuring structures are safe, sustainable, and cost-effective.

Name: Arabic Language Instruction
Description: The Department of Arabic Language Instruction (ALI) at AUC provides Arabic language courses for both native and non-native speakers, focusing on linguistic proficiency, cultural immersion, and academic communication. It supports students in mastering Modern Standard Arabic (MSA), colloquial Arabic, and Arabic for special purposes, ensuring they gain the skills needed for academic and professional success in Arabic-speaking environments.

Name: English Language Instruction
Description: The Department of English Language Instruction (ELI) equips students with academic English proficiency, emphasizing reading, writing, speaking, and listening skills. It offers intensive programs to prepare students for university coursework and professional communication, ensuring they meet AUC’s rigorous academic standards and thrive in an English-medium learning environment.

Name: Rhetoric and Composition
Description: The Department of Rhetoric and Composition focuses on critical thinking, argumentation, and effective writing. It prepares students to analyze, construct, and communicate ideas clearly across disciplines, enhancing their ability to engage in academic research, persuasive writing, and public discourse. The department plays a key role in AUC’s core curriculum, ensuring all students develop strong communication and analytical skills.

Name: Accounting
Description: The Youssef Nabih Department of Accounting at AUC provides students with a comprehensive understanding of financial reporting, auditing, taxation, and managerial accounting. It equips future professionals with analytical skills, ethical awareness, and technical expertise to navigate complex financial environments, ensuring they are prepared for careers in corporate finance, public accounting, and financial consulting.

Name: Economics
Description: The Mohamed Shafik Gabr Department of Economics focuses on economic theory, policy analysis, and global financial systems. Through a rigorous curriculum, students develop quantitative, analytical, and problem-solving skills to assess economic challenges and propose data-driven solutions. Graduates pursue careers in government, banking, international organizations, and economic research.

Name: Management
Description: The Heikal Department of Management prepares students for leadership roles in business, entrepreneurship, and organizational strategy. It emphasizes innovation, decision-making, and strategic planning, equipping graduates with the skills to excel in corporate leadership, startups, and business consultancy in a rapidly evolving global economy.

Name: Applied Linguistics and Educational Studies
Description: This department focuses on language acquisition, teaching methodologies, and educational policy. It prepares students to address challenges in language learning, curriculum development, and multilingual education, equipping them with the skills for careers in teaching, research, and educational consultancy.

Name: Arab and Islamic Civilizations
Description: Dedicated to exploring the history, literature, philosophy, and cultural heritage of the Arab and Islamic worlds, this department provides students with a deep understanding of classical and modern Arabic texts, Islamic traditions, and Middle Eastern history, preparing them for roles in academia, cultural preservation, and diplomacy.

Name: Arts
Description: A hub for creative expression, this department offers programs in visual arts, music, film, and theater, blending theory, history, and hands-on practice. It nurtures artists, performers, and cultural scholars, equipping them to contribute to the creative industries, media, and arts education.

Name: English and Comparative Literature
Description: This department explores literary traditions, critical theory, and global narratives, encouraging students to engage with texts across different cultures, time periods, and languages. Graduates excel in writing, publishing, academia, and cultural analysis.

Name: History
Description: Focusing on historical research, archival studies, and global historical narratives, this department helps students develop critical thinking and analytical skills. It prepares them for careers in academia, museum curation, policy analysis, and journalism.

Name: Philosophy
Description: This department delves into ethics, metaphysics, epistemology, and logic, training students to analyze complex ideas, question assumptions, and construct logical arguments. Graduates pursue paths in law, academia, ethics consulting, and public policy.

Name: Political Science
Description: Offering expertise in international relations, governance, and political theory, this department equips students with the tools to analyze political systems, global conflicts, and public policy. Graduates find careers in government, diplomacy, NGOs, and research institutions.

Name: Psychology
Description: Focusing on human behavior, cognition, and mental health, this department prepares students for roles in clinical psychology, counseling, organizational psychology, and research, combining scientific inquiry with practical application.

Name: Sociology, Egyptology, and Anthropology
Description: This interdisciplinary department studies social structures, ancient civilizations, and human cultures. Students explore contemporary social issues, archaeological discoveries, and anthropological research, leading to careers in cultural heritage management, archaeology, social work, and policy development.

Name: Architecture
Description: Blending design, sustainability, and urban planning, this department prepares students to create innovative and functional spaces while addressing environmental and societal challenges. Graduates pursue careers in architectural design, urban development, and green building technologies.

Name: Biology
Description: Focusing on genetics, molecular biology, ecology, and biomedical sciences, this department equips students with a deep understanding of life sciences and environmental sustainability, leading to careers in biotechnology, research, and healthcare.

Name: Chemistry
Description: Covering analytical, organic, inorganic, and physical chemistry, this department provides hands-on experience in laboratory research and chemical analysis, preparing students for roles in pharmaceuticals, materials science, and industrial chemistry.

Name: Computer Science
Description: Offering expertise in artificial intelligence, cybersecurity, software development, and data science, this department trains students to solve real-world problems using cutting-edge technology, leading to careers in tech startups, research, and software engineering.

Name: Construction Engineering
Description: Specializing in infrastructure development, project management, and sustainable construction, this department prepares students for leadership roles in civil engineering, urban development, and smart city planning.

Name: Electronics and Communications
Description: Focusing on circuit design, wireless communication, and digital systems, this department prepares students to work in telecommunications, semiconductor industries, and embedded systems development.

Name: Mathematics and Actuarial Science
Description: Developing expertise in mathematical modeling, statistical analysis, and risk assessment, this department equips students for careers in finance, insurance, data science, and quantitative research.

Name: Mechanical Engineering
Description: Exploring robotics, energy systems, thermodynamics, and manufacturing processes, this department prepares students for innovation in aerospace, automotive, and renewable energy industries.

Name: Petroleum and Energy Engineering
Description: Focusing on energy resource management, sustainable extraction, and oil and gas technologies, this department trains students for careers in energy exploration, environmental consulting, and renewable energy solutions.

Name: Physics
Description: Investigating quantum mechanics, electromagnetism, and material science, this department prepares students for scientific research, advanced technology development, and engineering applications in industries like aerospace, healthcare, and energy.

Name: Journalism and Mass Communication
Description: This department trains students in media production, digital journalism, and strategic communication, equipping them with the skills to thrive in broadcasting, public relations, and investigative reporting while upholding ethical and professional standards.

Name: Public Policy and Administration
Description: Focusing on governance, policymaking, and public service leadership, this department prepares students to analyze and implement policies that address economic, social, and political challenges, leading to careers in government agencies, NGOs, and international organizations.

Name: Law
Description: Offering a deep understanding of legal systems, human rights, and international law, this department trains students to engage in legal advocacy, corporate law, and policy reform, preparing them for roles in law firms, international courts, and public service.

Name: Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence
Description: Focuses on developing algorithms that enable computers to learn from and make decisions based on data. Students explore neural networks, deep learning, and natural language processing

Name: Data Science

Name: Web and Mobile Development

Name: Physical Computing and the Internet of Things (IoT)

Name: Games Development

Name: User Experience (UX)

Name: Accounting and Finance

Name: Business and Management

Name: Data Science and Business Analytics
Description: This programme combines data science techniques with business strategy. Students learn to solve interdisciplinary problems and make strategic decisions using data analytics, equipping them for roles in data analysis, business intelligence, and consultancy

Name: Economics
Description: Focusing on the forces that drive human behavior, global economies, and resource distribution, this programme provides a deep understanding of economic theories and their applications, preparing students for careers in economic analysis, policy-making, and research

Name: Economics and Finance
Description: Students learn to solve practical problems arising in both economics and finance, gaining insights into financial markets, investment strategies, and economic policy, suitable for careers in financial analysis, investment banking, and economic consultancy

Name: Economics and Management
Description: This programme applies economic principles, frameworks, and methodologies to management practice. Students develop analytical and problem-solving skills relevant to managerial roles in various industries

Name: Finance
Description: Focusing on financial systems, markets, and instruments, students gain a thorough understanding of corporate finance, investment, and risk management, preparing them for careers in financial services, banking, and investment management

Name: Mechatronics & Intelligent Machines

Name: Mechanical Engineering

Name: Motorsports Engineering

Name: Electrical & Electronic Engineering

Name: Animation

Name: Graphic Design

Name: Media and Communication
Description: Explores journalism, digital media, PR, and social media strategies. Students learn about content creation, media ethics, and audience engagement, preparing for roles in broadcasting, content marketing, and public relations.

Name: Media Production
Description: Covers film, TV, and digital content creation, teaching cinematography, video editing, sound design, and directing. Students gain hands-on experience in documentary filmmaking, online media, and studio production.

Name: Fashion Design

Combines fashion illustration, garment construction, textiles, and trend forecasting. Students design and create clothing collections, focusing on sustainability, brand identity, and the global fashion industry.

Each major emphasizes practical experience, industry collaborations, and career readiness.

Name: Marketing
Description: This program focuses on branding, digital marketing, consumer behavior, and market research. Students gain skills in social media marketing, advertising, data analytics, and strategic marketing planning, preparing for careers in marketing agencies, corporate marketing, and e-commerce.

Name: Human Resource Management
Description:
Covers recruitment, employee relations, performance management, and workplace policies. Students learn about HR strategy, organizational behavior, labor laws, and talent development, equipping them for roles in HR consulting, corporate HR departments, and people management.

Both programs emphasize real-world case studies, industry partnerships, and career readiness.

It includes subjects like international marketing, trade negotiations, global business strategies, and international economic relations.

Description:
This department offers courses on financial management, banking operations, financial markets, and investment strategies.
Students learn about corporate finance, risk management, and financial analysis.
