Name: Basic Science Department
Description:
Duration: 1-2 years
Description: Focuses on foundational knowledge in biology, physics, chemistry, and anatomy that are crucial for understanding physical therapy techniques.

Name: Physical Therapy for Internal Diseases Department
Description:
Duration: 2 years
Description: Specializes in applying physical therapy to treat patients with internal diseases, focusing on rehabilitation and recovery.

Name: Physical Therapy for Women's Health Department
Description:
Duration: 2 years
Description: Offers specialized treatments for women's health issues, including pregnancy-related conditions, pelvic floor dysfunction, and osteoporosis.

Name: Physical Therapy for Neurological Disorders Department
Description:
Duration: 2-3 years
Description: Concentrates on treating neurological conditions like stroke, Parkinson's, and spinal cord injuries, using physical therapy to restore motor function.

Name: Physical Therapy for Skin and Tissues Department
Description:
Duration: 2 years
Description: Focuses on the use of physical therapy techniques to treat skin conditions, wounds, and tissue repair after surgeries or injuries.

Name: Physical Therapy for Pediatric Patients Department
Description:
Duration: 2 years
Description: Specializes in providing physical therapy to children, addressing developmental issues and injuries to promote physical and motor development.

Name: Traditional Chinese Medicine Clinic
Description:
Duration: Throughout the program
Description: A unique offering at ECU that integrates traditional Chinese medical practices like acupuncture and herbal treatments with physical therapy for holistic treatment.

Name: Clinical Pharmacy Department
Description:
Duration: 5 years.
Focuses on training students to provide pharmaceutical care and consult on drug therapy management.

Name: Pharmaceutical Chemistry Department
Description:
Duration: 5 years.
Specializes in the chemistry of drugs and pharmaceutical formulations.

Name: Pharmaceutical Technology Department
Description:
Duration: 5 years.
Deals with the development and manufacturing of pharmaceutical products.

Name: Department of Computer Science
Description:
Study Focus: Focuses on algorithms, programming, artificial intelligence, data analysis, and network security. It aims to train students in software design and complex systems.
Duration: 4 years.

Name: Department of Information Systems
Description:
Study Focus: Focuses on integrating technology with business strategies, including system analysis and design, database management, and network technologies. It aims to develop students' skills in improving organizational performance through technology.
Duration: 4 years.

Name: Department of Graphic Design
Description:
Description:
This department focuses on developing students' skills in graphic design, including logos, advertisements, and digital media. Students learn to use various design tools like Photoshop, Illustrator, and others.
Duration: 4 years.
Content: Students learn to combine creativity with technology to design effective visual materials.

Name: Department of Fine Arts
Description:
Description:
This department focuses on developing artistic skills in drawing, sculpture, painting, and traditional art forms. The aim is to teach students how to express their ideas using various artistic materials.
Duration: 4 years.
Content: Students learn different art techniques, including academic drawing, sculpting on wood, pottery, and other forms of fine arts.

Name: Department of Fashion Design
Description:
Description:
This department teaches students how to design clothing and various styles, focusing on creativity in fashion design, fabric selection, and color coordination. Students are trained on how to bring their designs to life.
Duration: 4 years.
Content: Students study the latest fashion trends, innovation in design, as well as learning sewing skills and project management.

Name: Department of Interior Design
Description:
Description:
This department specializes in designing indoor spaces and coordinating decorations that meet the needs of a place and its occupants. Students learn how to organize spaces and select colors and furniture that reflect the personality of the place.
Duration: 4 years.
Content: Students learn how to design homes, offices, and commercial spaces, and how to create comfortable and aesthetically pleasing environments.

Name: Department of Animation
Description:
Description:
This department focuses on animation techniques and moving images. Students learn how to design and animate characters and stories, using advanced technologies like programming and 3D graphics.
Duration: 4 years.
Content: Students use animation software like "Adobe After Effects" and "Autodesk Maya" to create animated visuals.

Name: Department of Digital Arts
Description:
Description:
This department focuses on arts that use technology as a primary tool for creativity, such as digital arts, digital photography, and videos.
Duration: 4 years.
Content: Students learn how to transform ideas into artistic works using digital tools, such as digital drawing and photography.

Name: Anatomy and Histology
Description: This department focuses on the study of human anatomy and tissues, especially those related to the oral and maxillofacial regions. Students learn about the structure of teeth, gums, jaws, and related tissues to understand their function and relation to overall health.

Name: Physiology
Description: This department deals with the functions and mechanisms of various body systems, including those related to oral health. Students learn how bodily functions interact and how diseases affect the normal operation of the oral cavity.

Name: Biochemistry
Description: It covers the chemical processes and substances that occur within living organisms. Students study how biochemical reactions relate to oral health and diseases, including metabolic functions and nutrition.

Name: Microbiology & Immunology
Description: This department teaches students about microorganisms, including bacteria, viruses, and fungi, that can cause oral diseases. It also covers the immune response and how the body defends itself against infections.

Name: General Pathology
Description: The study of diseases affecting the entire body, with a particular focus on conditions that may impact oral health. Students learn how diseases develop, their symptoms, and potential treatments.

Name: Oral Pathology & Periodontology
Description: This field focuses on diagnosing and treating diseases of the oral cavity and supporting structures, such as gums and bones. It also emphasizes preventive measures and promoting periodontal health.

Name: Oral and Maxillofacial Surgery
Description: Students learn about surgical procedures involving the mouth, jaws, and face. This includes extractions, dental implants, trauma management, and corrective surgeries.

Name: Orthodontics
Description: This department specializes in diagnosing, preventing, and correcting dental irregularities. Students learn about braces, aligners, and other corrective devices used to enhance dental alignment.

Name: Pediatric Dentistry
Description: Focuses on dental care for children and adolescents, including preventive and therapeutic techniques to address childhood dental issues.

Name: Endodontics
Description: This department teaches the treatment of dental pulp disorders and procedures to save damaged teeth through root canal therapy.

Name: Prosthodontics
Description: Students learn to design and place dental prosthetics, including crowns, bridges, dentures, and implants, to restore damaged or missing teeth.

Name: Preventive Dentistry
Description: This department emphasizes techniques to prevent oral diseases, such as dental caries and gum diseases, through patient education and clinical strategies.

Name: Public Health Dentistry
Description: Focuses on promoting oral health at the community level, analyzing public health policies, and developing programs to improve dental health awareness.

Name: Department of Basic Dental Sciences
Description: Focuses on foundational subjects such as Biochemistry, Histology, and Microbiology to provide students with a strong understanding of the biological and chemical principles underlying dental practice.

Name: Department of Medical Sciences
Description: Covers essential medical subjects including Physiology, Pathology, and Pharmacology, ensuring students comprehend the medical aspects relevant to dental care.

Name: Department of Oral and Maxillofacial Surgery
Description: Provides training in the surgical management of diseases, injuries, and defects of the oral and facial regions, including procedures like tooth extractions and corrective surgeries.

Name: Department of Orthodontics and Pediatric Dentistry
Description: Specializes in diagnosing and treating dental and facial irregularities in children and adolescents, as well as providing preventive and corrective orthodontic care.

Name: Department of Periodontology and Oral Medicine
Description: Focuses on the study and treatment of gum diseases and conditions affecting the oral mucosa, integrating aspects of general medicine into dental practice.

Name: Department of Prosthodontics
Description: Deals with the design, creation, and fitting of artificial replacements for teeth and other parts of the mouth, aiming to restore function and aesthetics.

Name: Department of Conservative Dentistry and Endodontics
Description: Emphasizes the preservation of tooth structure through restorative procedures and the treatment of pulp-related diseases.

Name: Pharm.D.
Description:
Duration: 5 years
Description:
The Pharm.D. program is a comprehensive 5-year undergraduate course designed to provide students with deep knowledge in pharmaceutical sciences, clinical pharmacy, and drug development. The program includes practical training in both community and hospital pharmacy settings, focusing on the application of theoretical knowledge in real-world situations. Students gain clinical experience through internships, enhancing their ability to interact with patients and healthcare professionals. The program is designed to meet international standards and is accredited by the National Authority for Quality Assurance and Accreditation of Education (NAQAAE).
Focus Areas:
Pharmaceutical Sciences
Clinical Pharmacy
Drug Development and Research
Patient Care

Name: Clinical Pharmacy
Description:
Duration: 5 years
Description:
This specialized program focuses on the clinical aspects of pharmacy practice. It is designed to train students to become experts in providing pharmaceutical care in healthcare settings. The curriculum is built around the clinical application of pharmaceutical knowledge, with a strong emphasis on patient care, clinical decision-making, and medication therapy management. The program includes hands-on experience in hospitals and clinics to prepare students for real-life situations in clinical pharmacy.
Focus Areas:
Patient-Centered Pharmacy Practice
Clinical Decision-Making
Medication Therapy Management
Pharmacokinetics and Pharmacodynamics

Name: Research and Development Track
Description:
Duration: 5 years (with additional research opportunities)
Description:
This track offers students the opportunity to delve deeper into pharmaceutical research, focusing on the development and innovation of new drugs, formulations, and therapies. Students in this program are trained to conduct research in pharmaceutical sciences, including drug discovery, formulation science, and drug delivery systems. This program provides strong foundations in research methodologies and prepares students for careers in pharmaceutical industry research, academia, or regulatory agencies.
Focus Areas:
Drug Discovery and Development
Pharmaceutical Formulation
Drug Delivery Systems
Clinical Research and Regulatory Affairs

Name: Pharmaceutical Technology
Description:
Duration: 5 years
Description:
The Pharmaceutical Technology program focuses on the technological aspects of pharmacy, such as the development of pharmaceutical products, manufacturing, and quality control. Students will study pharmaceutical engineering, the production of drug dosage forms, and various technologies used in the pharmaceutical industry. The program prepares graduates to work in the pharmaceutical manufacturing industry, ensuring the quality and safety of pharmaceutical products.
Focus Areas:
Pharmaceutical Manufacturing
Quality Control and Assurance
Drug Formulation Technologies
Industrial Pharmaceutical Technology

Name: Basic Sciences Department
Description:
5 Years

This department provides foundational academic knowledge and basic physical therapy sciences. Students are introduced to anatomy, physiology, pathology, and biomechanics which prepare them for more advanced clinical courses throughout the five-year program.

Name: Biomechanics Department
Description:
5 Years

The Biomechanics Department focuses on the study of human body movements and the mechanical principles underlying those movements. Students learn how to analyze motion and apply these principles to physical therapy practices.

Name: Physical Therapy for Internal Medicine and Geriatrics Department
Description:
5 Years

This department specializes in treating internal diseases and health problems related to aging. It covers cardiopulmonary rehabilitation, diabetes management, and improving the quality of life for elderly patients through therapeutic exercises and interventions.

Name: Physical Therapy for Surgery and Burns Department
Description:
5 Years

Students in this department are trained to manage wounds, burns, and complications from surgeries. They learn techniques for post-operative care, scar management, and rehabilitation strategies to enhance patient recovery and mobility.

Name: Physical Therapy for Orthopedic Surgery Department
Description:
5 Years

This department focuses on musculoskeletal disorders, including fractures, joint replacements, and sports injuries. Students are trained in orthopedic rehabilitation, exercise prescription, and the use of orthotics and prosthetics.

Name: Physical Therapy for Obstetrics and Gynecology Department
Description:
5 Years

Students learn specialized techniques for prenatal and postnatal care. The department addresses pelvic floor disorders, post-surgical rehabilitation, and exercises aimed at enhancing women's health during and after pregnancy.

Name: Physical Therapy for Neurology and Neurosurgery Department
Description:
5 Years

This department deals with neurological conditions, including stroke, spinal cord injuries, multiple sclerosis, and Parkinson’s disease. Students learn rehabilitation techniques to help patients regain mobility, coordination, and independence.

Name: Physical Therapy for Pediatrics and Pediatric Surgery Department
Description:
5 Years

The Pediatric Department focuses on children with developmental delays, congenital disorders, or musculoskeletal issues. The curriculum covers motor development, therapeutic exercises, and rehabilitation strategies specific to pediatric patients.

Name: Architectural Engineering Department
Description:
5 Years
This department focuses on the design and planning of buildings and structures, considering both aesthetic and functional aspects. Students learn architectural design principles, construction techniques, and urban planning.

Name: Mechatronics Engineering Department
Description:
5 Years
This program combines mechanical engineering, electrical engineering, and computer engineering. Students gain skills in designing and developing smart systems, automation, and robotics.

Name: Computer Engineering and Artificial Intelligence Department
Description:
5 Years
This department emphasizes designing and developing computer systems and artificial intelligence applications. Students study computer programming, software design, and AI applications in various fields.

Name: Business Administration Department
Description:
4 Years
This department focuses on teaching students management, planning, organization, leadership skills, as well as marketing strategies and human resource management.

Name: Accounting Department
Description:
4 Years
This department provides students with knowledge of accounting principles, financial analysis, and report preparation, qualifying them to work as professional accountants in various sectors.

Name: Economics Department
Description:
4 Years
This department offers a deep understanding of economic theories, monetary and fiscal policies, and market analysis, helping students analyze and interpret economic phenomena.

Name: Quantitative Methods Department
Description:
4 Years
This department focuses on applying mathematical and statistical models to solve administrative problems and make data-driven decisions.

Name: Human Anatomy and Embryology
Description:
Description: Focuses on the structure of the human body, including the study of organs, tissues, and systems.
Duration: 1 year (usually studied in the first two years).

Name: Department of Physiology
Description:
Description: The study of the functions of the human body, including how organs and systems work together to maintain homeostasis.
Duration: 1 year (typically during the first two years)

Name: Department of Biochemistry
Description:
Description: Covers the chemical processes in living organisms, including metabolism and the roles of proteins, enzymes, and hormones.
Duration: 1 year (early stages of the program)

Name: Department of Pathology
Description:
Description: The study of diseases, including their causes, processes, and effects on the body.
Duration: 1 year (usually during the third year).

Name: Department of Pharmacology
Description:
Description: Focuses on the study of drugs, their effects, mechanisms of action, and therapeutic uses in the treatment of diseases.
Duration: 1 year (usually in the third year).

Name: Department of Microbiology and Immunology
Description:
Description: Focuses on the study of drugs, their effects, mechanisms of action, and therapeutic uses in the treatment of diseases.
Duration: 1 year (usually in the third year).

Name: Department of Parasitology
Description:
Description: Covers the study of microorganisms (such as bacteria and viruses) and the immune system's role in defending the body against infections.
Duration: 1 year (usually in the third year).

Name: Department of Community Medicine and Public Health
Description:
Description: Studies parasitic organisms that affect humans, including their life cycles and how they cause disease.
Duration: 1 year (typically in the early years of study)

Name: Department of Family Medicine
Description:
Description: Focuses on preventing diseases and promoting health within communities through education, policy, and management.
Duration: 1 year (usually in the later years of the program).

Name: Department of Forensic Medicine
Description:
Description: Provides students with knowledge about comprehensive healthcare for individuals and families, emphasizing prevention and long-term care.
Duration: 1 year (usually in the later years of the program)

Name: Department of Surgery
Description:
Description: This department deals with applying medical knowledge to legal cases, such as determining the causes of death and identifying poisons or toxins.
Duration: 1 year (typically in the later years of study).

Name: Department of Pediatrics
Description:
Description: The study and practice of surgical techniques, procedures, and interventions for treating various medical conditions.
Duration: 2 years (usually in the later years of the program).

Name: Department of Obstetrics and Gynecology
Description:
Description: Focuses on the medical care of infants, children, and adolescents, covering a wide range of childhood diseases and conditions.
Duration: 1 year (usually in the final years of study).

Name: Department of Ophthalmology
Description:
Description: Specializes in the care of women’s health, including pregnancy, childbirth, and disorders related to the female reproductive system.
Duration: 1 year (final years of the program).

Name: Department of Otorhinolaryngology (ENT)
Description:
Description: The study of diseases and disorders related to the eyes, including vision problems and surgical procedures for eye diseases.
Duration: 1 year (typically in the final years of study).

Name: Department of Psychiatry
Description:
Description: Focuses on the diagnosis, treatment, and prevention of mental health disorders and emotional well-being.
Duration: 1 year (final years of the program)

Name: Department of Radiological Sciences and Medical Imaging
Description:
Description: This department trains students in the use of medical imaging technologies, such as X-ray, MRI, CT scans, and ultrasound, to help diagnose diseases and conditions. Students learn how to operate imaging equipment, interpret images, and work with healthcare professionals to provide accurate diagnostic results.
Duration: 4 years (Bachelor's degree in Radiological Sciences and Medical Imaging)

Name: Department of Medical Laboratory Sciences
Description:
Description: Focuses on teaching students how to perform laboratory tests that aid in the diagnosis, treatment, and prevention of diseases. Students gain knowledge in microbiology, biochemistry, hematology, and immunology, and develop skills in analyzing blood, tissues, and other biological samples.
Duration: 4 years (Bachelor's degree in Medical Laboratory Sciences)

Name: Department of Physical Therapy and Rehabilitation
Description:
Description: This department provides students with the knowledge and practical skills needed to work as physical therapists. Students learn how to assess and treat physical impairments or injuries through exercise, manual therapy, and other rehabilitation techniques to help patients recover mobility and functionality.
Duration: 4 years (Bachelor's degree in Physical Therapy and Rehabilitation)

Name: Department of Health Information Management
Description:
Description: This program focuses on managing healthcare data and information systems within medical institutions. Students learn about health information technology, data management, privacy laws, and medical record keeping, which are essential for maintaining accurate and accessible patient records.
Duration: 4 years (Bachelor's degree in Health Information Management)

Name: Department of Fine Arts
Description:
Description: This department focuses on traditional arts such as painting, sculpture, and drawing. Students are trained in both classical and modern techniques to develop their creative skills and artistic vision.
Duration: 5 years (Bachelor's degree in Fine Arts)

Name: Department of Graphic Design
Description:
Description: Focuses on digital and print design, where students learn to create visual content for media, advertisements, websites, and more. It combines both artistic and technical skills in design principles.
Duration: 5 years (Bachelor's degree in Graphic Design)

Name: Department of Interior Design
Description:
Description: This department prepares students to design functional, aesthetic, and safe interior spaces for homes, offices, and commercial establishments. Students learn about space planning, materials, lighting, and furniture design.
Duration: 5 years (Bachelor's degree in Interior Design)

Name: Department of Fashion Design
Description:
Description: Students in this department study the art of designing clothing and accessories. They are trained in fashion illustration, fabric selection, garment construction, and fashion trend forecasting.
Duration: 5 years (Bachelor's degree in Fashion Design)

Name: Department of Industrial Design
Description:
Description: This department focuses on designing products that are both functional and aesthetically pleasing. Students learn about the design and manufacturing process for items like furniture, gadgets, and other consumer goods.
Duration: 5 years (Bachelor's degree in Industrial Design)

Name: Department of Architecture
Description:
Description: The department trains students in the art and science of designing buildings and other structures. Students learn architectural design principles, building construction, and urban planning.
Duration: 5 years (Bachelor's degree in Architecture)

Name: Department of English Language and Literature
Description:
Description: This department focuses on the study of the English language, literature, and translation. Students are trained in both literary analysis and translation techniques, with an emphasis on English grammar, vocabulary, and writing skills.
Duration: 4 years (Bachelor's degree in English Language and Literature)

Name: Department of German Language and Literature
Description:
Description: This department provides students with a deep understanding of the German language and its literature. It also trains students in translation skills, focusing on both written and oral translation between German and other languages.
Duration: 4 years (Bachelor's degree in German Language and Literature)

Name: Department of Chinese Language and Literature
Description:
Description: The department offers programs in the Chinese language, including its grammar, literature, and translation. Students learn to bridge communication between Arabic and Chinese speakers, with a focus on translation and cultural exchange.
Duration: 4 years (Bachelor's degree in Chinese Language and Literature)

Name: Artificial Intelligence and Information
Description:
Students in this program will learn the fundamentals of artificial intelligence (AI), machine learning, data science, and information technology. The program prepares graduates to design intelligent systems and analyze large datasets.
Duration: 4 years.

Name: Department of Endodontics (Root Canal Treatment)
Description:
Duration: 5 years + 1 year internship
Description: This department focuses on the diagnosis and treatment of diseases related to the roots of the teeth. Endodontics primarily involves root canal treatments to save teeth that are infected or damaged.

Name: Department of Oral and Maxillofacial Surgery
Description:
Duration: 5 years + 1 year internship
Description: This department deals with the surgical treatment of injuries, tumors, and deformities that affect the mouth, jaw, and face. Procedures include surgeries for impacted teeth, fractures, and other complex conditions.

Name: Department of Orthodontics
Description:
Duration: 5 years + 1 year internship
Description: The orthodontics department focuses on diagnosing, preventing, and treating dental and facial irregularities. Treatment methods often involve braces, retainers, and other devices to align the teeth and jaw.

Name: Department of Periodontology (Gum Diseases)
Description:
Duration: 5 years + 1 year internship
Description: This department is concerned with the diagnosis and treatment of gum diseases, such as gingivitis and periodontitis. Periodontists focus on maintaining the health of the gums and supporting structures of the teeth.

Name: Department of Prosthodontics (Restorative Dentistry)
Description:
Duration: 5 years + 1 year internship
Description: Prosthodontics involves the restoration and replacement of missing or damaged teeth. This includes the use of crowns, bridges, dentures, and implants to restore function and appearance.

Name: Department of Cardiac Physiotherapy
Description:
Duration: 5 years + 1-year internship
Description: This department focuses on treating patients with cardiovascular diseases such as heart failure, hypertension, and post-surgical recovery. Treatment plans include exercise, breathing techniques, and other physical rehabilitation methods to improve heart function and increase the patient's endurance and overall well-being.

Name: Department of Neurological Physiotherapy
Description:
Duration: 5 years + 1-year internship
Description: The neurological physiotherapy department deals with patients suffering from neurological disorders such as stroke, spinal cord injury, Parkinson's disease, and multiple sclerosis. The primary goal is to restore movement, improve coordination, and alleviate symptoms through physical therapy and rehabilitation techniques.

Name: Department of Musculoskeletal Physiotherapy
Description:
Duration: 5 years + 1-year internship
Description: This department addresses musculoskeletal problems, including joint pain, fractures, sprains, and post-surgical recovery. It focuses on physical therapy methods to improve mobility, strengthen muscles, and reduce pain through treatments like manual therapy, electrotherapy, and exercises designed to restore normal function.

Name: Department of Pediatric Physiotherapy
Description:
Duration: 5 years + 1-year internship
Description: Pediatric physiotherapy specializes in treating children with developmental delays, cerebral palsy, musculoskeletal problems, or neurological disorders. The department uses specialized techniques and activities tailored to the child’s needs to improve motor skills, strength, and overall development.

Name: Department of Geriatric Physiotherapy
Description:
Duration: 5 years + 1-year internship
Description: This department focuses on providing physiotherapy services to elderly patients, addressing issues like arthritis, osteoporosis, balance disorders, and mobility issues due to aging. Treatment aims to improve the quality of life by enhancing mobility, flexibility, and reducing the risk of falls.

Name: Department of Sports Physiotherapy
Description:
Duration: 5 years + 1-year internship
Description: Sports physiotherapy focuses on the rehabilitation and prevention of sports-related injuries. The department works with athletes to recover from injuries, improve flexibility and strength, and prevent future injuries through targeted rehabilitation programs and performance-enhancing exercises.

Name: Department of Respiratory Physiotherapy
Description:
Duration: 5 years + 1-year internship
Description: This department treats patients with respiratory issues such as asthma, chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD), and post-surgical lung rehabilitation. Respiratory physiotherapy helps patients improve lung function and breathing efficiency through exercises and specialized techniques that promote better oxygen flow.

Name: Department of Dermatological Physiotherapy
Description:
Duration: 5 years + 1-year internship
Description: Dermatological physiotherapy focuses on treating skin conditions that affect physical function, such as burn injuries, chronic wounds, and skin ulcers. The department applies physical treatments that promote healing, reduce pain, and improve the patient's quality of life.

Name: Department of Physiotherapy for Oncology (Cancer Rehabilitation)
Description:
Duration: 5 years + 1-year internship
Description: This department offers rehabilitation to cancer patients to improve their physical health during and after cancer treatment. Physiotherapists help patients recover strength, mobility, and endurance while managing fatigue and the side effects of chemotherapy or radiation therapy.

Name: Department of Internal Medicine Physiotherapy
Description:
Duration: 5 years + 1-year internship
Description: This department focuses on the treatment and rehabilitation of patients with internal medical conditions like diabetes, hypertension, and obesity. The goal is to help patients improve their functional abilities, prevent complications, and maintain a healthy lifestyle through physical therapy methods and exercise regimens.

Name: Department of Clinical Pharmacy
Description:
Duration: 5 years + 1-year internship
Description: This department focuses on the application of pharmaceutical sciences in direct patient care. Clinical pharmacists work closely with healthcare teams to ensure the safe and effective use of medications. Students are trained to evaluate patient conditions, manage pharmacotherapy, and prevent drug-related problems through evidence-based practices. They also gain skills in counseling patients and educating them about proper medication use.

Name: Department of Pharmaceutical Chemistry
Description:
Duration: 5 years + 1-year internship
Description: This department specializes in the study of the chemical composition and structure of drugs. It involves the design, synthesis, and analysis of pharmaceutical compounds. Students learn how to develop new drugs, optimize drug formulations, and ensure their safety and efficacy. Research in this field aims to innovate in drug development and improve existing medications.

Name: Department of Microbiology and Immunology in Pharmacy
Description:
Duration: 5 years + 1-year internship
Description: Students in this department explore the role of microorganisms in disease and the body’s immune response. They study bacterial, viral, fungal, and parasitic infections and their treatment with antimicrobial drugs. The department also delves into immunology, training students to understand how drugs interact with the immune system, particularly in vaccine development and immunotherapy.

Name: Department of Industrial Pharmacy
Description:
Duration: 5 years + 1-year internship
Description: Industrial pharmacy focuses on the processes involved in the manufacturing, quality control, and distribution of pharmaceutical products. Students learn about drug formulation, production techniques, and regulatory requirements for the pharmaceutical industry. The department also covers the development of new drug delivery systems and ensures the safety and quality of pharmaceutical products at scale.

Name: Department of Toxicology and Forensic Pharmacy
Description:
Duration: 5 years + 1-year internship
Description: This department examines the harmful effects of drugs and chemicals on the body. Students learn how to assess poisoning, drug overdose, and the safety of pharmaceutical products. They are trained in forensic pharmacy to understand the legal aspects of drugs, including how substances are analyzed in criminal investigations and medical malpractice cases.

Name: Department of Neuropharmacology
Description:
Duration: 5 years + 1-year internship
Description: This department focuses on the study of how drugs affect the nervous system. It includes the exploration of drugs used to treat neurological disorders such as Parkinson’s disease, epilepsy, and schizophrenia. Students are trained to understand the mechanisms of action of these drugs and how they can be used to treat conditions that affect the brain and spinal cord.

Name: Department of Pharmaceutical Care
Description:
Duration: 5 years + 1-year internship
Description: Pharmaceutical care is a patient-centered approach where pharmacists take responsibility for managing and optimizing drug therapy. Students in this department are trained to assess patients’ needs, develop personalized treatment plans, and monitor patient outcomes. The goal is to enhance therapeutic outcomes and minimize adverse effects of medications.

Name: Department of Pharmacology and Therapeutics
Description:
Duration: 5 years + 1-year internship
Description: Students in this department learn about the interaction of drugs with the body, focusing on drug absorption, distribution, metabolism, and excretion (ADME). The curriculum covers the therapeutic use of drugs in treating various conditions and diseases, and students gain hands-on experience in prescribing and managing medication therapies effectively.

Name: Department of Analytical Chemistry
Description:
Duration: 5 years + 1-year internship
Description: This department focuses on the techniques used to analyze the chemical composition of pharmaceutical substances. Students learn how to use advanced laboratory equipment to test the purity, strength, and safety of drugs. Analytical chemistry is essential for quality control, drug development, and ensuring compliance with industry standards and regulations.

Name: Department of Biopharmaceutical Sciences
Description:
Duration: 5 years + 1-year internship
Description: The Biopharmaceutical Sciences department integrates biology, chemistry, and pharmacology to study how biological substances affect drug formulation and action. Students explore the pharmacokinetics and pharmacodynamics of various drugs, and they gain expertise in understanding how drugs interact with the body on a molecular level.

Name: Department of Medical-Surgical Nursing
Description:
Duration: 4 years + 1-year internship
Description: This department focuses on providing nursing care to patients in medical and surgical settings. Students in this department are trained to assist in the management of patients undergoing surgeries or being treated for various medical conditions. They develop critical thinking skills, clinical decision-making abilities, and learn how to manage pre- and post-operative care, pain management, and recovery.

Name: Department of Critical Care and Emergency Nursing
Description:
Duration: 4 years + 1-year internship
Description: This department prepares students to work in high-pressure environments such as intensive care units (ICU) and emergency departments (ED). The program emphasizes advanced skills in monitoring, stabilizing, and treating patients with life-threatening conditions. Students also learn how to handle trauma, cardiac emergencies, respiratory failure, and other critical health situations.

Name: Department of Obstetrics and Gynecological Nursing
Description:
Duration: 4 years + 1-year internship
Description: This department specializes in the care of women during pregnancy, childbirth, and the postpartum period. Students gain hands-on experience in labor and delivery rooms, assisting with childbirth and providing care to both mothers and newborns. They also study the nursing care of women’s reproductive health, including gynecological surgeries and postpartum recovery.

Name: Department of Pediatric Nursing
Description:
Duration: 4 years + 1-year internship
Description: In this department, students are trained to provide nursing care to infants, children, and adolescents. The focus is on child development, pediatric diseases, and treatments. Students gain practical experience in pediatric wards, working with children of various ages and handling common pediatric conditions, vaccinations, and emergency care.

Name: Department of Mental Health and Psychiatric Nursing
Description:
Duration: 4 years + 1-year internship
Description: This department focuses on the mental and emotional well-being of patients. Students are trained to provide nursing care to individuals suffering from mental health disorders, such as anxiety, depression, and schizophrenia. The program includes understanding psychiatric conditions, managing patient behavior, and offering therapeutic interventions. Students also gain insight into various psychiatric therapies, medications, and crisis interventions.

Name: Department of Advertising Arts and Animation
Description:
Duration: 5 years + 1-year internship
Description: This department focuses on creating visual solutions for advertising campaigns and media through animation and graphic design. Students learn to design print, digital, and animated advertisements, focusing on branding, communication strategies, and creative visual storytelling. The curriculum also includes skills in motion graphics, 2D/3D animation, and digital media tools, preparing students for roles in advertising agencies, media production companies, and digital design firms.

Name: Department of Fashion Design and Jewelry
Description:
Duration: 5 years + 1-year internship
Description: Students in this department explore both fashion design and jewelry design, with a focus on creativity and craftsmanship. They gain practical skills in designing clothing, accessories, and jewelry collections, learning about textile technology, pattern making, and the art of jewelry crafting. The curriculum combines traditional techniques with modern fashion trends, providing students with the tools needed to pursue careers as fashion designers, jewelry designers, or fashion merchandisers.

Name: Department of Interior Design and Decoration
Description:
Duration: 5 years + 1-year internship
Description: This department trains students in the art and science of designing interior spaces that are functional, aesthetic, and comfortable. Students learn to create residential, commercial, and institutional interior designs, focusing on space planning, materials, lighting, color theory, and decoration. The department emphasizes creativity, technical skills, and sustainability in design, preparing students for careers in interior design firms, architecture firms, or as independent designers.

Name: Department of Civil Engineering
Description:
Duration: 5 years
Description: This department focuses on the design, construction, and maintenance of infrastructure, including buildings, roads, bridges, and dams. Students will study structural engineering, materials science, geotechnical engineering, and construction management. The program prepares students for careers in urban planning, construction, and infrastructure development.

Name: Department of Mechanical Engineering
Description:
Duration: 5 years
Description: This department deals with the design, analysis, and manufacturing of mechanical systems and machines. Students will learn about thermodynamics, fluid mechanics, materials science, and mechanical design. The program prepares students for work in industries such as automotive, aerospace, energy, and manufacturing.

Name: Department of Electrical Engineering
Description:
Duration: 5 years
Description: Students in this department focus on designing and developing electrical systems and equipment, including power generation, distribution systems, and electrical devices. The program covers topics such as circuits, control systems, power systems, electronics, and telecommunications. Graduates can work in industries like energy, telecommunications, electronics, and automation.

Name: Department of Computer Engineering
Description:
Duration: 5 years
Description: This department focuses on the design and development of computer systems, software, and networks. Students will learn about programming, computer architecture, databases, algorithms, and network security. The program prepares students for careers in software development, network management, cybersecurity, and IT consulting.

Name: Department of Architectural Engineering
Description:
Duration: 5 years
Description: This department prepares students to design and plan buildings and structures, with an emphasis on both aesthetics and functionality. Students will study architectural design, building systems, urban planning, and sustainable design. The program equips graduates to work in architectural firms, construction companies, and urban development projects.

Name: Department of Electronics and Communication Engineering
Description:
Duration: 5 years
Description: Students in this department learn how to design, develop, and maintain electronic systems and communication technologies, such as mobile networks, satellite communication, and broadband systems. The program covers topics like signal processing, telecommunications, digital electronics, and embedded systems. Graduates can pursue careers in telecommunications, electronics, and data communication industries.

Name: Anatomy and Embryology
Description:
Description: This department focuses on the detailed structural organization of animals, including the study of bones, muscles, organs, blood vessels, and nerves. It also covers the developmental processes from fertilization to the formation of a complete organism, emphasizing comparative anatomy between various species.
Years of Study: Mainly covered during 1st and 2nd years.

Name: Histology (Microscopic Anatomy)
Description:
Description: This department studies the microscopic structure of animal tissues and cells, examining their composition, function, and how they contribute to the overall physiology of the animal. Special focus is given to understanding tissue differentiation and cellular organization.
Years of Study: Taught in the 1st and 2nd years.

Name: Physiology
Description:
Description: Focuses on understanding the normal biological functions of animals, including how organs and systems interact and respond to external and internal changes. It covers topics such as neurophysiology, cardiovascular systems, respiratory systems, digestive systems, and hormonal regulation.
Years of Study: Primarily covered in the 1st and 2nd years.

Name: Biochemistry
Description:
Description: Explores the chemical processes and substances that occur within living organisms, including metabolism, enzyme activity, molecular biology, and genetics. It also covers the biochemical basis of diseases and nutritional biochemistry.
Years of Study: Mostly taught during the 1st and 2nd years.

Name: Pharmacology
Description:
Description: Studies the effects, mechanisms, and therapeutic uses of drugs in animals, including safe usage, dosages, toxicology, pharmacokinetics, and pharmacodynamics. It prepares students to understand drug interactions and their clinical applications.
Years of Study: Covered in the 3rd year.

Name: Microbiology and Immunology
Description:
Description: Focuses on microorganisms (bacteria, viruses, fungi) that cause diseases in animals, along with the immune system's responses to these pathogens. Topics include bacteriology, virology, mycology, immunology, and vaccination techniques.
Years of Study: Taught in the 2nd and 3rd years.

Name: Parasitology
Description:
Description: Studies parasites (internal and external) affecting animals, their life cycles, disease transmission, diagnosis, prevention, and control methods. Topics include protozoology, helminthology, and arthropodology.
Years of Study: Mainly covered in the 3rd year.

Name: Internal Medicine
Description:
Description: Deals with diagnosing, preventing, and treating non-surgical diseases affecting various organs and systems in animals. It focuses on clinical examination, case analysis, disease management, and animal welfare.
Years of Study: Taught during the 4th and 5th years.

Name: Surgery, Anesthesiology, and Radiology
Description:
Description: Provides knowledge and practical skills in surgical procedures, anesthesia administration, diagnostic imaging techniques (such as X-rays, ultrasound), wound management, and postoperative care.
Years of Study: Primarily covered in the 4th and 5th years.

Name: Poultry Diseases
Description:
Description: Specializes in the diagnosis, treatment, and prevention of diseases affecting poultry species. It covers infectious diseases, metabolic disorders, nutritional deficiencies, and biosecurity measures.
Years of Study: Taught in the 4th and 5th years.

Name: Zoonotic Diseases (Common Diseases)
Description:
Description: Studies diseases that are transmissible between animals and humans. Topics include epidemiology, diagnosis, control, prevention, and public health safety.
Years of Study: Covered during the 4th and 5th years.

Name: Food Hygiene and Control
Description:
Description: Ensures the safety and quality of animal-derived food products through inspection, quality control, and preventive measures. It also covers food-borne diseases, contamination control, and processing standards.
Years of Study: Taught in the 4th and 5th years.

Name: Obstetrics, Reproduction, and Artificial Insemination
Description:
Description: Focuses on animal reproduction, reproductive physiology, obstetric procedures, artificial insemination, pregnancy diagnosis, and reproductive health management.
Years of Study: Mainly covered in the 4th and 5th years.

Name: Computer Science (CS)
Description:
Description: This department focuses on studying algorithms, data structures, programming languages, operating systems, and computational theories. It aims at developing software and understanding fundamental concepts in computer science.
Years of Study: The curriculum is covered over four years.

Name: Artificial Intelligence (AI)
Description:
Description: This department focuses on designing and developing intelligent systems capable of learning, reasoning, and making decisions. Topics include machine learning, natural language processing, computer vision, and robotics.
Years of Study: The courses are offered over four years.

Name: Information Systems (IS)
Description:
Description: This department studies how to effectively collect, store, and retrieve information. It emphasizes designing and developing information systems to support administrative operations and decision-making processes.
Years of Study: The program is taught over four years.

Name: Information Technology (IT)
Description:
Description: This department focuses on applying technology in business and industrial sectors. Topics include networking, cybersecurity, database management, software engineering, and cloud computing.
Years of Study: The courses are provided over four years.

Name: Anatomy and Embryology
Description:
Description: This department focuses on the structure of the human body and the development of the embryo from conception to birth. Students learn about the anatomy of organs, tissues, and systems, using both theoretical and practical approaches, including dissection and imaging techniques.
Years of Study: Mainly covered during the 1st and 2nd years.

Name: Physiology
Description:
Description: This department studies the functions of various body systems, including the cardiovascular, respiratory, nervous, endocrine, digestive, and musculoskeletal systems. It aims to explain how these systems work individually and collectively to maintain homeostasis.
Years of Study: Primarily covered during the 1st and 2nd years.

Name: Biochemistry
Description:
Description: This department focuses on the chemical processes that occur within living organisms. It covers essential topics like metabolism, enzymology, molecular biology, genetics, and the biochemical basis of diseases.
Years of Study: Mostly taught during the 1st and 2nd years.

Name: Pathology
Description:
Description: This department studies the nature and causes of diseases by examining tissues, organs, and bodily fluids. It aims to understand disease mechanisms, classifications, and their effects on body functions. Pathology serves as a bridge between basic sciences and clinical medicine.
Years of Study: Primarily covered during the 3rd and 4th years.

Name: Pharmacology
Description:
Description: This department studies the effects of drugs on the human body. Topics include drug mechanisms, therapeutic uses, side effects, pharmacokinetics (absorption, distribution, metabolism, and excretion), and pharmacodynamics (drug-receptor interactions).
Years of Study: Taught during the 3rd and 4th years.

Name: Microbiology and Immunology
Description:
Description: This department focuses on microorganisms (bacteria, viruses, fungi, parasites) that cause diseases in humans and the body's immune response to these pathogens. It covers topics like immunology, virology, bacteriology, and mycology.
Years of Study: Mostly covered during the 2nd and 3rd years.

Name: Community Medicine and Public Health
Description:
Description: This department focuses on the health of populations, emphasizing disease prevention, epidemiology, health education, and primary healthcare. It also includes training in conducting research and statistical analysis.
Years of Study: Covered during the 4th and 5th years.

Name: Forensic Medicine and Toxicology
Description:
Description: This department deals with applying medical knowledge to legal cases, including injury analysis, cause of death, and poison detection. It also covers the study of toxins and their effects on the human body.
Years of Study: Taught during the 4th year.

Name: Clinical Departments (Medicine, Surgery, Pediatrics, Obstetrics & Gynecology, etc.)
Description:
Description: These departments provide practical and theoretical training in various medical and surgical specialties. Students gain hands-on experience through clinical rotations in areas such as General Medicine, General Surgery, Pediatrics, Obstetrics & Gynecology, Dermatology, Psychiatry, Orthopedics, Ophthalmology, ENT, and Emergency Medicine.
Years of Study: Covered during the 4th, 5th, and 6th years.

Name: Medical Education and Research
Description:
Description: A relatively new department focusing on modern teaching methodologies, medical ethics, and research skills. It aims to prepare students for future medical research and evidence-based practice.
Years of Study: Integrated throughout the six years of study.

Name: Oral and Maxillofacial Surgery
Description:
Description: This department focuses on the diagnosis and surgical treatment of conditions affecting the mouth, jaws, and face. It includes complex tooth extractions, corrective jaw surgeries, and facial trauma management.
Years of Study: Mainly covered during the 4th and 5th years.

Name: Orthodontics
Description:
Description: This department deals with diagnosing and correcting dental and facial misalignments. It includes using braces, aligners, and other appliances to improve oral function and aesthetics.
Years of Study: Primarily covered during the 4th and 5th years.

Name: Endodontics
Description:
Description: This department focuses on treating diseases of the dental pulp and periapical tissues. It includes procedures like root canal therapy aimed at preserving natural teeth.
Years of Study: Taught during the 3rd and 4th years.

Name: Pediatric Dentistry
Description:
Description: This department provides specialized oral healthcare for children and adolescents. It emphasizes preventive care, behavioral management, and treatment of dental issues affecting young patients.
Years of Study: Covered during the 4th and 5th years.

Name: Prosthodontics
Description:
Description: This department deals with restoring and replacing damaged or missing teeth using fixed and removable prostheses such as crowns, bridges, and dentures. It focuses on functional rehabilitation and aesthetic restoration.
Years of Study: Mainly covered during the 4th and 5th years.

Name: Periodontology
Description:
Description: This department focuses on the prevention, diagnosis, and treatment of periodontal (gum) diseases. It includes surgical and non-surgical therapies to manage gum infections and promote oral health.
Years of Study: Taught during the 3rd and 4th years.

Name: Oral Medicine and Diagnosis
Description:
Description: This department specializes in diagnosing and managing diseases affecting the oral and maxillofacial region. It also involves developing appropriate treatment plans for various oral conditions.
Years of Study: Covered during the 3rd and 4th years.

Name: Dental Materials
Description:
Description: This department studies the properties, uses, and biocompatibility of various materials used in dental treatments. It ensures the quality and safety of restorative materials applied in clinical practice.
Years of Study: Integrated throughout the 2nd, 3rd, and 4th years.

Name: Oral Biology
Description:
Description: This department focuses on the biological structure and function of oral tissues, including teeth, gums, and supporting structures. It provides foundational knowledge crucial for clinical practice.
Years of Study: Mainly covered during the 1st and 2nd years.

Name: Oral and Maxillofacial Radiology
Description:
Description: This department deals with diagnostic imaging of the oral and maxillofacial regions using X-rays, CT scans, and other radiographic techniques to detect and manage various conditions.
Years of Study: Taught during the 3rd and 4th years.

Name: Adult Health Nursing
Description:
Description: This department focuses on providing nursing care to adult patients with acute and chronic health conditions. It includes comprehensive assessment, diagnosis, planning, implementation, and evaluation of care. Emphasis is placed on promoting health, preventing illness, managing chronic diseases, and rehabilitating patients to their optimal level of health. Students also learn to utilize evidence-based practice to deliver safe and effective care.
Years of Study: Covered mainly during the 2nd, 3rd, and 4th years.

Name: Maternal and Newborn Health Nursing
Description:
Description: This department provides specialized training in caring for women during pregnancy, childbirth, and the postpartum period, as well as newborns. Students learn to manage prenatal care, labor and delivery, postpartum recovery, and complications that may arise during these stages. Additionally, emphasis is placed on reproductive health education, family planning, and neonatal care.
Years of Study: Primarily taught during the 3rd and 4th years.

Name: Pediatric Nursing
Description:
Description: Pediatric Nursing focuses on providing nursing care to children from infancy through adolescence. The curriculum covers growth and development, pediatric health assessment, managing common childhood illnesses, and promoting health and wellness in children. Students also gain skills in communicating with children and their families to ensure holistic and family-centered care.
Years of Study: Mainly covered during the 3rd and 4th years

Name: Community Health Nursing
Description:
Description: This department emphasizes promoting health and preventing disease at the community level. Students learn to assess community health needs, design and implement health promotion programs, and evaluate their effectiveness. They are also trained in conducting epidemiological studies, disaster management, and providing culturally competent care to diverse populations.
Years of Study: Taught throughout the 2nd, 3rd, and 4th years.

Name: Mental Health Nursing
Description:
Description: Mental Health Nursing focuses on providing nursing care to individuals with mental health disorders. This department teaches students how to assess, diagnose, and treat patients experiencing psychiatric conditions, such as anxiety, depression, schizophrenia, and mood disorders. Additionally, students learn therapeutic communication techniques, crisis intervention, and rehabilitation strategies to support patients' recovery and improve their quality of life.
Years of Study: Primarily taught during the 3rd and 4th years.

Name: Nursing Administration
Description:
Description: Nursing Administration prepares students to become leaders and managers within the healthcare system. It focuses on developing skills in organizational management, health policy, quality improvement, financial management, and effective leadership. Students learn to supervise nursing teams, manage healthcare resources, and ensure high-quality patient care through strategic decision-making.
Years of Study: Covered mainly during the 4th year.

Name: Critical Care Nursing (Specialization)
Description:
Description: This specialized area focuses on providing advanced nursing care to critically ill patients in intensive care units (ICUs). It includes managing life-threatening conditions, using specialized equipment, and performing high-level monitoring and interventions. Students also learn to collaborate effectively with interdisciplinary teams to provide comprehensive care.
Years of Study: Typically an elective or specialization covered in the 4th year.

Name: Midwifery Nursing (Specialization)
Description:
Description: Midwifery Nursing focuses on providing holistic care to women during pregnancy, childbirth, and the postpartum period. Students are trained to conduct prenatal examinations, assist in labor and delivery, and offer postpartum care, including breastfeeding support. The curriculum also includes reproductive health education, family planning, and managing high-risk pregnancies.
Years of Study: Usually offered as an elective or specialization during the 4th year.

Name: Geriatric Nursing (Specialization)
Description:
Description: This department focuses on providing specialized care to the elderly population. Students learn to address the unique health challenges associated with aging, such as chronic diseases, dementia, mobility issues, and end-of-life care. The curriculum emphasizes promoting dignity, autonomy, and improving the quality of life for older adults.
Years of Study: Taught primarily during the 4th year.

Name: Department of English Language
Description:
Description: Focuses on developing advanced skills in English language, literature, and linguistics. Students engage in comprehensive studies of English-speaking cultures, enhancing their proficiency in reading, writing, speaking, and critical analysis.
Years of Study: Throughout the 4-year program.

Name: Department of French Language
Description:
Description: Centers on mastering the French language, exploring Francophone literature, and understanding the cultural nuances of French-speaking regions. The curriculum includes translation studies and applied linguistics.
Years of Study: Throughout the 4-year program

Name: Department of German Language
Description:
Description: Aims to provide proficiency in German, coupled with studies in German literature, culture, and applied linguistics. Students learn translation techniques and gain insights into German-speaking societies.
Years of Study: Throughout the 4-year program

Name: Department of Spanish Language
Description:
Description: Offers in-depth knowledge of the Spanish language, its literature, and the diverse cultures of Spanish-speaking countries. The program emphasizes translation skills and cultural studies.
Years of Study: Throughout the 4-year program.

Name: Department of Italian Language
Description:
Description: Provides comprehensive training in Italian language and literature, along with insights into Italy's rich cultural heritage. The curriculum includes translation practices and applied linguistic studies.
Years of Study: Throughout the 4-year program.

Name: Department of Chinese Language
Description:
Description: Focuses on Mandarin Chinese proficiency, exploring Chinese literature, culture, and societal structures. Students engage in translation studies and gain a deep understanding of China's global influence.
Years of Study: Throughout the 4-year program.

Name: Department of Japanese Language
Description:
Description: Emphasizes the Japanese language, literature, and cultural studies. The program includes translation techniques and offers insights into Japan's historical and contemporary society.
Years of Study: Throughout the 4-year program.

Name: Department of Korean Language
Description:
Description: Aims to develop proficiency in Korean, with studies in Korean literature, culture, and applied linguistics. Students learn translation skills and explore Korea's role in global contexts.
Years of Study: Throughout the 4-year program.

Name: Department of Russian Language
Description:
Description: Offers training in the Russian language, literature, and cultural studies. The curriculum includes translation practices and an exploration of Russia's historical and geopolitical significance.
Years of Study: Throughout the 4-year program.

Name: Department of Translation and Interpretation
Description:
Description: Specializes in developing skills for translating and interpreting between languages. The program covers various translation theories, simultaneous and consecutive interpreting techniques, and practical applications in diverse fields.
Years of Study: Typically introduced in the 3rd and 4th years.

Name: Interior Architecture Program
Description:
Description: This program focuses on designing functional and aesthetically pleasing interior spaces. Students learn about spatial design, materials, lighting, and ergonomics to create environments that enhance user experience. The curriculum emphasizes creativity, technical skills, and sustainability in interior architecture. 

Duration: The program spans 4 academic years (8 semesters).

Name: Graphic Design and Branding Program
Description:
Description: This program engages students in interdisciplinary problem-solving, combining visual experience with skills and knowledge in communication, technology, and business. Students learn to create visual content for various media, develop branding strategies, and understand the impact of design on consumer behavior. 
Duration: The program spans 4 academic years (8 semesters).

Name: Hotel and Resort Management Program
Description:
Description: This program focuses on developing students' skills in managing hotels and resorts, emphasizing operational efficiency, customer service excellence, and strategic planning. Students learn about various aspects of hospitality management, including front office operations, housekeeping, food and beverage management, and event planning. The curriculum integrates theoretical knowledge with practical training to prepare students for leadership roles in the hospitality industry.
Duration: The program spans 4 academic years (8 semesters).

Name: Recreation and Tourism Management Program
Description:
Description: This program aims to equip students with the knowledge and skills necessary to manage recreational activities and tourism services. It covers areas such as tourism planning, sustainable tourism development, leisure management, and cultural heritage tourism. Students gain insights into designing and promoting tourism experiences that cater to diverse markets while ensuring environmental and cultural sustainability.
Duration: The program spans 4 academic years (8 semesters).

Name: Event Management in Hospitality and Tourism Program
Description:
Description: This program prepares students to plan, organize, and manage events within the hospitality and tourism sectors. It encompasses event planning, marketing, logistics, risk management, and stakeholder engagement. Students learn to coordinate various types of events, including conferences, exhibitions, festivals, and corporate functions, with a focus on delivering memorable experiences and achieving organizational objectives.
Duration: The program spans 4 academic years (8 semesters).

Name: Architecture and Building Sciences
Description:
Description: This track focuses on the principles of architectural design, construction materials, structural systems, and building technologies. Students engage in designing functional and aesthetic spaces, considering both form and function.
Duration: Integrated within the 5-year program.

Name: Urban Planning
Description:
Description: This track emphasizes the planning and development of urban areas, addressing issues such as land use, transportation, environmental sustainability, and community development. Students learn to design urban spaces that enhance the quality of life.
Duration: Integrated within the 5-year program.

Name: Accounting and Information Systems
Description:
4 years
This program combines the fundamentals of accounting with modern information systems, equipping students with the skills to manage financial records and analyze data in business contexts. Graduates will be proficient in preparing financial statements, auditing, and utilizing accounting software to enhance business efficiency. The program also emphasizes the importance of information technology in modern accounting practices.

Name: Investment and Finance
Description:
4 years
The Investment and Finance program prepares students for careers in the financial sector. It covers core concepts such as financial analysis, investment strategies, risk management, and corporate finance. Students will learn how to evaluate investment opportunities, understand market behavior, and manage financial portfolios. The program aims to develop strong analytical and decision-making skills necessary for success in finance-related professions.

Name: Marketing and International Business
Description:
4 years
This program focuses on the global aspects of marketing and business management. Students will learn how to create effective marketing strategies, understand consumer behavior, and manage international business operations. The curriculum includes courses in digital marketing, international trade, market research, and cross-cultural communication. The goal is to prepare students for careers in global marketing and international business environments.

Name: Applied Agricultural Economics
Description:
4 years
This department focuses on the application of economic principles in the agricultural sector. It covers topics such as consumer behavior, market analysis, agricultural policy evaluation, and the financial aspects of agricultural businesses. The program aims to equip students with the analytical skills needed to solve economic problems related to farming, rural development, and agricultural policy.

Name: Animal and Fish Production
Description:
4 years
The Animal and Fish Production department emphasizes the breeding and management of livestock and fish. Students learn about improving productivity, managing animal health, and producing high-quality animal and fish products. The program covers topics like animal husbandry, aquaculture, and sustainable production methods, aiming to prepare students for careers in both terrestrial and aquatic animal industries.

Name: Poultry Science
Description:
4 years
This program is centered around poultry farming, focusing on the breeding, health, and management of poultry species. Students gain in-depth knowledge of the techniques used in egg and meat production. The program includes the study of poultry diseases, nutrition, breeding practices, and environmental control methods, preparing graduates for roles in poultry production and management.

Name: Ruminant Science
Description:
4 years
Ruminant Science studies the breeding, management, and nutrition of ruminants like cattle, sheep, and goats. Students learn to improve productivity and manage the health of these animals. The program covers topics such as ruminant nutrition, breeding techniques, and disease management. The focus is on enhancing the efficiency of ruminant production, which is crucial for both food security and sustainable agriculture.

Name: Fisheries Science
Description:
4 years
Fisheries Science is dedicated to the study of aquatic ecosystems, fish production, and fishery management. Students explore sustainable practices in fish farming and the conservation of marine resources. The program covers topics such as aquatic biology, fish health management, and environmental issues related to fishery sustainability. Graduates are prepared to work in aquaculture, fishery management, and research fields.

Name: Water Science
Description:
4 years
Water Science focuses on water resources management, irrigation techniques, and sustainable water usage in agriculture. Students learn about water conservation, water treatment technologies, and how to optimize water resources for agricultural production. The program provides essential knowledge to address global water challenges and ensures the sustainability of agricultural practices that rely on water.

Name: Food Science and Technology
Description:
4 years
This department focuses on the scientific and technological aspects of food production, preservation, and safety. Students explore food processing, packaging, and product development, along with food safety and quality assurance practices. The program also covers the innovation of new food products and their nutritional benefits. Graduates are equipped for careers in food processing, quality control, and the development of new food technologies.

Name: Plant Protection
Description:
4 years
The Plant Protection department teaches students how to protect crops from pests, diseases, and weeds. Students gain knowledge in pest management techniques, plant disease identification, and integrated pest management strategies. This program is crucial for ensuring crop health and improving yields while minimizing the use of harmful chemicals. The goal is to provide students with practical solutions for sustainable agriculture practices.

Name: Petroleum Chemistry
Description:
4 years
This program focuses on the chemistry involved in petroleum extraction, refining processes, and the development of new techniques for the petroleum industry. Students learn about the chemical composition of petroleum products and the latest advancements in energy resources.

Name: Marine Biology
Description:
4 years
The Marine Biology program is dedicated to studying marine organisms and their environments. It covers topics like the impact of environmental changes on marine life and strategies for preserving marine biodiversity. Students gain practical and theoretical knowledge to contribute to marine conservation and sustainable fisheries management.

Name: Biotechnology
Description:
4 years
The Biotechnology program emphasizes the application of biotechnology in various fields such as medicine, agriculture, and industry. Students learn how to develop new drugs, improve crop production, and create bio-based materials using biotechnological advancements.
